definition: to lose/to leave behind/to omit/to bequeath/sth lost/involuntary discharge (of urine etc)
to do/to grow/to write or compose/to pretend/to regard as/to feel/writings or works

sentences.english: This paper is a comprehensive study of Heller's posthumous novel Portrait of an Artist, as an Old Man.
sentences.chinese: 本文是对海勒遗作《老年艺术家画像》的综合探讨。

sentences.english: Ne-Yo doesnt want to hear the posthumous Michael Jackson album.
sentences.chinese: 尼欧不想听迈克尔杰克逊的遗作专辑。

sentences.english: This is the last posthumous issue.
The swansong of the late writer will soon be published.
sentences.chinese: 这名已故作家的遗作不久将会出版。

sentences.english: With this first posthumous album, however, a different approach was taken.
sentences.chinese: 然而到了第一张遗作专辑，却采用了不同的方法。

sentences.english: The French painter's swansong was sold at a very high price at the auction.
sentences.chinese: 这名法国画家的遗作在拍卖中以很高价钱卖出。

sentences.english: The works by the Ming quarter will be collated into a book, widely circulated.
sentences.chinese: 遗作经季会明等整理成书，广泛流传。

sentences.english: But some presume they were made by Turks.
sentences.chinese: 不过有人推测是古代突厥人的遗作。

definition: to die/to depart this life (euphemism)/same as 去世
words written on one’s deathbed/an artist's final work/swansong
to die/to depart this mortal coil
(of a deceased) during one's life/while living
representative work (of an author or artist)
to create/to produce/to write/creative work/creation/CL:個|个[ge4]
